oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Quagga, who fed her hungry child with a piece of her own liver, and whose death was caused by her husband, the Jackal, who put poisoned pieces of sharp bone into her bed, because his relations said that he had married 'meat'. Her death was avenged by her own family. In the Katkop dialect, by !kwéiten ta ||kën (L VI.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Quagga's story
